remarks: Lemma for ~ fta :  "growth lemma".  There exists some ` r ` such that ` F ` is arbitrarily close in proportion to its dominant term. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Sep-2014.)
statement:
ftalem.1 $e |- A = ( coeff ` F ) $.
ftalem.2 $e |- N = ( deg ` F ) $.
ftalem.3 $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( Poly ` S ) ) $.
ftalem.4 $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
ftalem1.5 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
ftalem1.6 $e |- T = ( sum_ k e. ( 0 ... ( N - 1 ) ) ( abs ` ( A ` k ) ) / E ) $.
ftalem1 $p |- ( ph -> E. r e. RR A. x e. CC ( r < ( abs ` x ) -> ( abs ` ( ( F ` x ) - ( ( A ` N ) x. ( x ^ N ) ) ) ) < ( E x. ( ( abs ` x ) ^ N ) ) ) ) $.
$d A k r x $.
$d E r $.
$d F k r x $.
$d N k r x $.
$d S k $.
$d T k r x $.
$d k ph x $.
